page.title: 12BARTONBURY
page.content: Bartonbury is an old Devonshire house in the parish of Down St Mary. It was built about 1545-50. Bartonbury has had some recent changes but apart from that most of it is original. The hall has still got its open fireplace. All the old Devon farmhouses at that time had their living room and kitchen combined, and the original house at Bartonbury was the same, but it was enlarged in 1620 to take a growing family, and a kitchen was added at one end, with a bedroom above. At the other end of the house a big barn was built. The hall had oak panelling all round, and beside the fireplace is an ancient doorway leading to an old staircase which is the original one from 400 years ago.
